page.title: 10Local History
page.content: Eastoft at one time was split by the River Don,the North side in Yorkshire and the South in Lincolnshire.8 years ago boundary changes meant Eastoft became part of South Humberside. 23 years ago the old church school was replaced;there were only 22 pupils on roll. Five years ago,the Church Institute was modernised to become the Eastoft Village Hall. Eastoft no longer has a resident vicar;the vicarage being occupied by the Bradwell family.Now the villages of Swinefleet,Whitgift,Adlingfleet and Eastoft are known as the Marshland Group of Parishes and share one vicar,who lives at Whitgift. The principal work of the village is farming ,the larger farmers being Messrs Godfrey,Coulman,Halkon,Bramhill
